text:
Situation Finding Volumes

The following tasks all involve finding the volume of right prisms.

Examine each task and answer the questions.

Filling a Fish Tank

The diagram shows a fish tank after a container of water is poured into it.

  • What fraction of the tank does the container fill?
  • Using the same container, how many containers are needed to fill the tank?

• 2/5 or 4/10. One container can hold 120 in3 of water and the tank contains 300 in3 of water. 120 is 2/5 (or 4/10 or 0.4 or 40%) of 300, because 20/300 = 4/10 = 2/5 .
  • 2 Â½ or 5/2. The volume of the container used to fill a fish tank is 5x15x135 = 120 in3. To fill the tank, you need 5x15x4 = 300 in3 of water. If you pour another container of water, the volume of water will be 240 in3. Then, if you pour another half the container of water, which is 60 in3, it will add up to 300 in3. So, you need 2 1/2 or 2.5 containers. Another way to find the number of containers is dividing the volume of the tank by the volume of container: 300 / 120 = 2.5.

A Clay Sculpture

Making a Clay Sculpture

The sculpture below is made of clay. It is a prism with an odd-shaped but congruent top and bottom. The top and bottom each have an area of 10 square feet. The height is 4 feet.

  • What is the volume of the prism?
  • If clay comes in rectangular packages that are 1 foot by 1 foot by 2.5 feet, how many packages of clay are needed for the sculpture? Explain your reasoning.

• 40 ft3. You can find the volume by multiplying the area of base by its height. 10 x 4 = 40.
  • 16. The volume of the sculpture is 40 ft3 and the volume of a clay package is 1 x 1 x 2.5 = 2.5 ft3. Then you need 16 clay packages because 40/2.5 = 16.

Designing a New Smoothie Bar

The Nutritious Juice Bar is designing a new shape for its Smoothie Bar. It is a triangular prism with congruent equilateral bases.

  • Length of rectangle: 8 cm
  • Base of triangle: 2.5 cm
  • Height of triangle: 1.5 cm

What is the volume of the bar?

Design another bar using a different right prism that has the same volume.
15cm3. The area of base triangle is 2.5 x 1.5 x 1/2 = 1.875 cm2 and the volume of the bar is 1.875 x 8 = 15cm3

Answers will vary. Students can make changes in the shape of base or the height of prism. Possible answers will include:

  • Right triangular prism: when the legs of right triangle are 5 and 1.5 and the height of prism is 4. The area of triangle is 5 x 1.5 x 1/2 = 3.75 cm2 and the volume of the bar is 3.75 x 4 = 15 cm3.
  • Rectangular prism: when the dimensions of base rectangle are both 2.5 and the height of prism is 2.4. The area of base rectangle (square) is 2.5 x 2.5 = 6.25 cm2 and the volume of the bar is 6.25 x 2.4 = 15cm3.
